title: Edge-Unfolding Polycubes with Orthogonally Convex Layers
abstract:
A polycube is an orthogonal polyhedron composed of unit cubes glued together
along entire faces, homeomorphic to a sphere. A polycube layer is the section
of the polycube that lies between two horizontal cross-sections of the polycube
at unit distance from each other. An edge unfolding of a polycube involves
cutting its surface along any of the constituent cube edges and flattening it
into a single, non-overlapping planar piece. We show that any polycube with
orthogonally convex layers can be edge unfolded.
